That's a great idea! Mentioning your love for attending workshops and masterclasses is a fantastic way to showcase your commitment to continuous learning and improvement as a performer. It also highlights your proactive approach to refining your craft, which is admirable and impressive.

By sharing this interest, you're conveying to the audience that you're dedicated to staying updated on the latest techniques, trends, and best practices in the industry. It also suggests that you're open to feedback, willing to take risks, and eager to push yourself outside of your comfort zone.

In the context of playing Éponine, it's especially relevant to mention your interest in stage combat and dialect coaching, as these skills are crucial for bringing authenticity and nuance to the role. It shows that you're taking the time to develop the specific skills required for the character, which demonstrates your dedication to the production and your passion for the craft.

Here's an example of how you could incorporate this into your bio:

"[Your Name] is a [hometown]-based actress and singer who has appeared in numerous productions, including [notable credits]. Trained at [training institution], she has honed her craft in musical theater, dance, and voice. With a passion for continuous learning and improvement, [Your Name] regularly attends workshops and masterclasses to refine her skills, including a recent stage combat workshop and an upcoming dialect coaching intensive. She is thrilled to bring her skills and dedication to the iconic role of Éponine in Les Misérables."

By highlighting your love for workshops and masterclasses, you're adding a personal touch to your bio that showcases your commitment to your craft and your passion for growth as a performer.
